livegrep

Fast, regular expression code search service

47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 32 To run `livegrep`, you need to invoke both the `codesearch` backend
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 33 index/search process, and the `livegrep` web interface.

47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 36 built both `codesearch` and `livegrep`:

47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 38 In one terminal, start the `codesearch` server like so:

3aebe78dc173f0849f82fc1c0d4dc97bd23c5b55[Wed, 18 Jan 2017 21:16:25 -0600][tpcwang <tpc.wang@gmail.com>] 40 bazel-bin/src/tools/codesearch -grpc localhost:9999 doc/examples/livegrep/index.json
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 41

c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 43

47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 50 ## Using Index Files
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 51
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 52 The `codesearch` binary is responsible for reading source code,
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 53 maintaining an index, and handling searches. `livegrep` is stateless
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 54 and relies only on the connection to `codesearch` over a TCP
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 55 connection.
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 56
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 57 By default, `codesearch` will build an in-memory index over the
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 58 repositories specified in its configuration file. You can, however,
9c7cdb9ebf8ed20dfca3e254f21e57bc392c4fb1[Thu, 27 Feb 2020 12:57:10 -0800][Paul Tarjan <github@paulisageek.com>] 59 also instruct it to save the index to a file on disk. This has the dual
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 60 advantages of allowing indexes that are too large to fit in RAM, and
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 61 of allowing an index file to be reused. You instruct `codesearch` to
f08a41baf56ac5c27f56a31421c0cbd7c02b65ff[Sat, 13 May 2017 15:53:38 -0500][Ted Wang <tpc.wang@gmail.com>] 62 generate an index file via the `-dump_index` flag and to not launch
f08a41baf56ac5c27f56a31421c0cbd7c02b65ff[Sat, 13 May 2017 15:53:38 -0500][Ted Wang <tpc.wang@gmail.com>] 63 a search server via the `-index_only` flag:
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 64
4772363a42229754e6b89882900d4ee1de96afea[Sat, 13 May 2017 20:52:46 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 65 bazel-bin/src/tools/codesearch -index_only -dump_index livegrep.idx doc/examples/livegrep/index.json
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 66
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 67 Once `codeseach` has built the index, this index file can be used for
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 68 future runs. Index files are standalone, and you no longer need access
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 69 to the source code repositories, or even a configuration file, once an
47be1a25d373ff911823eabf883d91b52e55216c[Fri, 17 Jul 2015 10:52:38 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 70 index has been built. You can just launch a search server like so:
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 71
3aebe78dc173f0849f82fc1c0d4dc97bd23c5b55[Wed, 18 Jan 2017 21:16:25 -0600][tpcwang <tpc.wang@gmail.com>] 72 bazel-bin/src/tools/codesearch -load_index livegrep.idx -grpc localhost:9999
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 73
5fd015ede3c48aaac98eb3c6113f93f60dd6e585[Wed, 27 Feb 2019 15:29:28 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 74 The schema for the `codesearch` configuration file defined using
5e9183d1c630c8081150059d3744c258f3359e1c[Thu, 15 Aug 2019 22:19:25 +0900][Yuki Takizawa <y.takizawa64@gmail.com>] 75 protobuf in [src/proto/config.proto](src/proto/config.proto).
5fd015ede3c48aaac98eb3c6113f93f60dd6e585[Wed, 27 Feb 2019 15:29:28 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 76
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 77 ## `livegrep`
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 78
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 79 The `livegrep` frontend accepts an optional position argument
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 80 indicating a JSON configuration file; See

c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 83 options.
c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 84
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 85 By default, `livegrep` will connect to a single local codesearch
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 86 instance on port `9999`, and listen for HTTP connections on port
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 87 `8910`.
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 88
4d37593b607d4fa08cf735d5e9ad5ea8af76c00a[Sun, 28 Sep 2014 15:49:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 89 [server.json]: https://github.com/livegrep/livegrep/blob/master/doc/examples/livegrep/server.json

c3daed01a13fd6e86659fde7309f0e6eee1500a2[Wed, 14 May 2014 17:32:06 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 91
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 92 ## github integration
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 93
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 94 `livegrep` includes a helper driver, `livegrep-github-reindex`, which
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 95 can automatically update and index selected github repositories. To
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 96 download and index all of my repositories (except for forks), storing
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 97 the repos in `repos/` and writing `nelhage.idx`, you might run:
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 98
fca0f5a51a8edb73b5a35144b3b4f209f9a5caf7[Thu, 18 Aug 2016 19:32:26 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 99 bazel-bin/cmd/livegrep-github-reindex/livegrep-github-reindex -user=nelhage -forks=false -name=github.com/nelhage -out nelhage.idx
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 100
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 101 You can now use `nelhage.idx` as an argument to `codesearch
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 102 -load_index`.
49b6e0ccb2a524bcf9baf3b9d5fc7126afb640e9[Sat, 18 Jul 2015 16:56:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 103
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 104 ## Local repository browser
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 105 `livegrep` provides the ability to view source files directly in `livegrep`, as
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 106 an alternative to linking files to external viewers. This was initially implemented
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 107 by @jboning [here](https://github.com/livegrep/livegrep/pull/70). There are
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 108 a few ways to enable this. The most important steps are to
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 109 1. Generate a config file that `livegrep` can use to figure out where your
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 110 source files are (locally).
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 111 2. Pass this config file as an argument to the frontend (`-index-config`)
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 112
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 113 ### Generating index manually
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 114
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 115 See [doc/examples/livegrep/server.json](doc/examples/livegrep/server.json) for an
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 116 example config file, and [server/config/config.go](server/config/config.go) for documentation on available options. To enable the file viewer, you must include an [`IndexConfig`](server/config/config.go#L61) block inside of the config file. An example `IndexConfig` block can be seen at [doc/examples/livegrep/index.json](doc/examples/livegrep/index.json).
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 117
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 118 *Tip: For each repository included in your `IndexConfig`, make sure to include `metadata.url_pattern` if you would like the file viewer to be able to link out to the external host. You'll see a warning in your browser console if you don't do this.*
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 119
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 120 ### Generating index with `livegrep-github-reindex`
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 121 If you are already using the `livegrep-github-reindex` tool, an IndexConfig index file is generated for you, by default named "livegrep.json".
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 122
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 123 Run the indexer
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 124 ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 125 bazel-bin/cmd/livegrep-github-reindex/livegrep-github-reindex_/livegrep-github-reindex -user=xvandish -forks=false -name=github.com/xvandish -out xvandish.idx ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 126 ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 127
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 128 The indexer will have done these main things:
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 129 1. Clone (or update) all repositories for `user=xvandish` to/in `repos/xvandish`
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 130 2. Create an IndexConfig file - `repos/livegrep.json`
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 131 3. Create a code index, this is whats used to search - `./xvandish.idx`
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 132
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 133 Here's an abbreviated version of what your directory might look like after running the indexer.
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 134 ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 135 livegrep
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 136 │ xvandish.idx
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 137 └───repos
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 138 │ │ livegrep.json
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 139 │ └───xvandish
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 140 │ └───repo1
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 141 │ └───repo2
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 142 │ └───repo3
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 143 ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 144
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 145 ### Using your generated index
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 146 Now that you generated an index file, it's time to run livegrep with it.
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 147
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 148 Run the backend:
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 149 ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 150 bazel-bin/src/tools/codesearch -load_index xvandish.idx -grpc localhost:9999
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 151 ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 152
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 153 Run the frontend in another shell instance with the path to the index file located at `repos/livegrep.json`.
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 154 ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 155 bazel-bin/cmd/livegrep/livegrep_/livegrep -index-config ./repos/livegrep.json
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 156 ```
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 157 In a browser, now visit `http://localhost:8910` and you should see a working
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 158 livegrep. Search for something, and once you get a result, click on the file
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 159 name or a line number. You should now be taken to the file browser!
74f249946800bda2c6bc9e53813c4163355db7ea[Tue, 12 Oct 2021 19:38:18 -0700][Rodrigo Silva Mendoza <xvandish@users.noreply.github.com>] 160
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 161 Docker images
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 162 -------------
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 163
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 164 I build [docker images][docker] for livegrep out of the
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 165 [livegrep.com](https://github.com/livegrep/livegrep.com) repository,
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 166 based on build images created by this repository's CI. They should be
9c8a84a0a17ded836b4248e4ad58ee98159ae635[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:27:17 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 167 generally usable. For instance, to build+run a livegrep index of this
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 168 repository, you could run:
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 169
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 170 ```
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 171 docker run -v $(pwd):/data livegrep/indexer /livegrep/bin/livegrep-github-reindex -repo livegrep/livegrep -http -dir /data
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 172 docker network create livegrep
d8d0288e5a92f96b9145a6d171e56d64e41e9296[Wed, 19 Aug 2020 14:28:29 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 173 docker run -d --rm -v $(pwd):/data --network livegrep --name livegrep-backend livegrep/base /livegrep/bin/codesearch -load_index /data/livegrep.idx -grpc 0.0.0.0:9999
d8d0288e5a92f96b9145a6d171e56d64e41e9296[Wed, 19 Aug 2020 14:28:29 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 174 docker run -d --rm --network livegrep --publish 8910:8910 livegrep/base /livegrep/bin/livegrep -docroot /livegrep/web -listen=0.0.0.0:8910 --connect livegrep-backend:9999
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 175 ```
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 176
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 177 And then access http://localhost:8910/
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 178
9c8a84a0a17ded836b4248e4ad58ee98159ae635[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:27:17 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 179 You can also find the [docker-compose config powering
9c8a84a0a17ded836b4248e4ad58ee98159ae635[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:27:17 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 180 livegrep.com][docker-compose] in that same repository.
9c8a84a0a17ded836b4248e4ad58ee98159ae635[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:27:17 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 181
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 182 [docker]: https://hub.docker.com/u/livegrep
9c8a84a0a17ded836b4248e4ad58ee98159ae635[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:27:17 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 183 [docker-compose]: https://github.com/livegrep/livegrep.com/tree/master/compose
7b201ea640efc9e47b4479a687d2033d8e1057ae[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 22:25:14 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 184
826617b184ebfa675a22ae926cf7a7cc96e9f4ba[Mon, 11 Feb 2013 09:49:21 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 185 Resource Usage
826617b184ebfa675a22ae926cf7a7cc96e9f4ba[Mon, 11 Feb 2013 09:49:21 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 186 --------------
826617b184ebfa675a22ae926cf7a7cc96e9f4ba[Mon, 11 Feb 2013 09:49:21 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 187
826617b184ebfa675a22ae926cf7a7cc96e9f4ba[Mon, 11 Feb 2013 09:49:21 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 188 livegrep builds an index file of your source code, and then works
826617b184ebfa675a22ae926cf7a7cc96e9f4ba[Mon, 11 Feb 2013 09:49:21 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 189 entirely out of that index, with no further access to the original git
826617b184ebfa675a22ae926cf7a7cc96e9f4ba[Mon, 11 Feb 2013 09:49:21 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 190 repositories.
826617b184ebfa675a22ae926cf7a7cc96e9f4ba[Mon, 11 Feb 2013 09:49:21 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 191
fafe1b95ff41825d6792181cd122390d1ee5534a[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 21:06:16 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 192 The index file will vary somewhat in size, but will usually be 3-5x
fafe1b95ff41825d6792181cd122390d1ee5534a[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 21:06:16 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 193 the size of the indexed text. `livegrep` memory-maps the index file
fafe1b95ff41825d6792181cd122390d1ee5534a[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 21:06:16 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 194 into RAM, so it can work out of index files larger than (available)
fafe1b95ff41825d6792181cd122390d1ee5534a[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 21:06:16 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 195 RAM, but will perform better if the file can be loaded entirely into
fafe1b95ff41825d6792181cd122390d1ee5534a[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 21:06:16 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 196 memory. Barring that, keeping the disk on fast SSDs is recommended for
fafe1b95ff41825d6792181cd122390d1ee5534a[Sat, 16 Feb 2019 21:06:16 +0000][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 197 optimal performance.
826617b184ebfa675a22ae926cf7a7cc96e9f4ba[Mon, 11 Feb 2013 09:49:21 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 198
8b764dcc04f6b6a4fb195f88b13d38f908da4ca6[Wed, 6 Feb 2013 23:55:46 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 199
8b764dcc04f6b6a4fb195f88b13d38f908da4ca6[Wed, 6 Feb 2013 23:55:46 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 200 LICENSE
8b764dcc04f6b6a4fb195f88b13d38f908da4ca6[Wed, 6 Feb 2013 23:55:46 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 201 -------
8b764dcc04f6b6a4fb195f88b13d38f908da4ca6[Wed, 6 Feb 2013 23:55:46 -0800][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>] 202
37a0ed6b46f6921d40a14dad22fe5498fe77f33b[Thu, 15 Aug 2019 22:36:35 +0900][Yuki Takizawa <y.takizawa64@gmail.com>] 203 Livegrep is open source. See [COPYING](COPYING) for more information.
